values.description:
The gazebo/manifest.xml got purged from the repo but not the CMakeLists.txt so `make install` pukes. This fixes that by just commenting it out, but now the gazebo directory is empty, so we might just delete the whole folder. Your call Morgan.

Also, I made sure the correct filename is put into the gazebo_manifest_generator.
values.title: Minor build fixes for gazebo model generator

summary.raw:
The gazebo/manifest.xml got purged from the repo but not the CMakeLists.txt so `make install` pukes. This fixes that by just commenting it out, but now the gazebo directory is empty, so we might just delete the whole folder. Your call Morgan.

Also, I made sure the correct filename is put into the gazebo_manifest_generator.
summary.html:
The gazebo/manifest.xml got purged from the repo but not the CMakeLists.txt so make install pukes. This fixes that by just commenting it out, but now the gazebo directory is empty, so we might just delete the whole folder. Your call Morgan.

Also, I made sure the correct filename is put into the gazebo_manifest_generator.

values.title: update ROS_PACKAGE_PATH so don't have to setup path explicitly before compiling

values.description: I was testing the build on a new machine, and the build failed silently when I didn't have a ros configuration setup.sh sourced. I added a fatal error message in the root CMakeLists.txt to ensure that the check occurs before any ROS commands are invoked.
values.title: Warn if ROS can't be found in ENV path

summary.raw: I was testing the build on a new machine, and the build failed silently when I didn't have a ros configuration setup.sh sourced. I added a fatal error message in the root CMakeLists.txt to ensure that the check occurs before any ROS commands are invoked.

values.description:
Infer ROS distro from user's environment, allowing user to override manually. Similar code was added to drcsim. I also made a minor build fix.

I'd like to figure out how to check the ROS_PACKAGE_PATH to give an intelligible warning message if they don't have osrf_common/ and sandia-hand/ros in the ROS_PACKAGE_PATH, but that can happen later.

values.description:
I check the dependencies of the current ROS package using `rospack deps` on the current package folder before trying to build and give the user a warning if there are dependency problems. I added the warning to sandia_hand_teleop because this is where the build gets stuck. Here's the warning it gives now if the ROS_PACKAGE_PATH isn't set properly:
~~~
CMake Error at CMakeLists.txt:13 (message):
  You have a ROS package dependency problem: [rospack] Error: package/stack
  sandia_hand_teleop depends on non-existent package osrf_msgs
~~~
values.title: Warn if there are ROS package dependency problems.

summary.raw:
I check the dependencies of the current ROS package using `rospack deps` on the current package folder before trying to build and give the user a warning if there are dependency problems. values.description:
Rename gazebo manifest.xml files to model.config and database.config per [gazebo pull request 242](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/pull-request/242). The database.config was not actually used, so it can be renamed. Older versions of gazebo expect a manifest.xml, so install both side-by-side for compatibility.

This was intended to eliminate confusion between ROS manifest.xml's and gazebo's config files.

This also will eliminate warning messages when starting up gazebo-1.4.
values.title: Rename gazebo manifest.xml files

summary.raw:
Rename gazebo manifest.xml files to model.config and database.config per [gazebo pull request 242](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/pull-request/242). The database.config was not actually used, so it can be renamed. Older versions of gazebo expect a manifest.xml, so install both side-by-side for compatibility.

This was intended to eliminate confusion between ROS manifest.xml's and gazebo's config files.

This also will eliminate warning messages when starting up gazebo-1.4.
summary.html:
Rename gazebo manifest.xml files to model.config and database.config per gazebo pull request 242. The database.config was not actually used, so it can be renamed. Older versions of gazebo expect a manifest.xml, so install both side-by-side for compatibility.

This was intended to eliminate confusion between ROS manifest.xml's and gazebo's config files.

This also will eliminate warning messages when starting up gazebo-1.4.

values.description:
To try it:

    roslaunch atlas_utils atlas_sandia_hands.launch &
    roslaunch sandia_hand_teleop nanokontrol_simple_grasp.launch

Grasps are assigned to the first few sliders.  Hold down the top button to the left of a slider to activate that grasp.  Combining grasps is not supported.
values.title: add slider control for simple grasping

summary.raw:
To try it:

    roslaunch atlas_utils atlas_sandia_hands.launch &
    roslaunch sandia_hand_teleop nanokontrol_simple_grasp.launch

Grasps are assigned to the first few sliders.  Hold down the top button to the left of a slider to activate that grasp.  Combining grasps is not supported.
summary.html:
To try it:

roslaunch atlas_utils atlas_sandia_hands.launch &
roslaunch sandia_hand_teleop nanokontrol_simple_grasp.launch

Grasps are assigned to the first few sliders. Hold down the top button to the left of a slider to activate that grasp. Combining grasps is not supported.

values.description:
without jeopardizing ability of hand to grasp example objects via manual teleoperation, temporarily reduce inertia by factor of 10 (still 100X of what they should be if joints were frictionless).

Working on alternatives (e.g. constraint stabilization), but will leave it as is for now until working.

without jeopardizing ability of hand to grasp example objects via manual teleoperation, temporarily reduce inertia by factor of 10 (still 100X of what they should be if joints were frictionless).

Working on alternatives (e.g. constraint stabilization), but will leave it as is for now until working.
summary.html:
without jeopardizing ability of hand to grasp example objects via manual teleoperation, temporarily reduce inertia by factor of 10 (still 100X of what they should be if joints were frictionless).

values.description:
This pull request adds stereo cameras to to the palm of each hand, with a 40 mm baseline. The pull request should be tested against [gazebo branch issue_camera_pose](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/compare/issue_camera_pose..default), which has a pull request pending.

The only issue right now is that the ros topic API for the cameras does not match that listed in the [DRC User Guide](http://gazebosim.org/wiki/DRC/UserGuide#ROS_APIs). The user guide API uses l_hand and r_hand, while this pull request uses left_hand and right_hand instead. This was done because the xacro parameter ${side} contains either left or right, and I wasn't sure how to pull out the first character of that using xacro. Otherwise, we can make an additional parameter for specifying the ros topic, but this will require a coordinated change with drcsim.
values.title: Add cameras to sandia_hand_description

summary.raw:
This pull request adds stereo cameras to to the palm of each hand, with a 40 mm baseline. The pull request should be tested against [gazebo branch issue_camera_pose](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/compare/issue_camera_pose..default), which has a pull request pending.

The only issue right now is that the ros topic API for the cameras does not match that listed in the [DRC User Guide](http://gazebosim.org/wiki/DRC/UserGuide#ROS_APIs). The user guide API uses l_hand and r_hand, while this pull request uses left_hand and right_hand instead. This was done because the xacro parameter ${side} contains either left or right, and I wasn't sure how to pull out the first character of that using xacro. Otherwise, we can make an additional parameter for specifying the ros topic, but this will require a coordinated change with drcsim.
summary.html:
This pull request adds stereo cameras to to the palm of each hand, with a 40 mm baseline. The pull request should be tested against gazebo branch issue_camera_pose, which has a pull request pending.

The only issue right now is that the ros topic API for the cameras does not match that listed in the DRC User Guide. The user guide API uses l_hand and r_hand, while this pull request uses left_hand and right_hand instead. This was done because the xacro parameter ${side} contains either left or right, and I wasn't sure how to pull out the first character of that using xacro. Otherwise, we can make an additional parameter for specifying the ros topic, but this will require a coordinated change with drcsim.

values.description:
In pull request #18, I mentioned that the ros topic names didn't satisfy the API published in the DRC user guide because there weren't the proper xacro parameters available.

I didn't realize it, but the drcsim xacro is already passing "l_hand" and "r_hand" as the xacro parameter named parent (referring to the parent link name). So without modifying drcsim, this pull request will fix the ROS topic API.

I also modified the sandia_hand_both_on_box model so that it would still work with this change.
values.title: Fix camera topics for drcsim, without changing drcsim

summary.raw:
In pull request #18, I mentioned that the ros topic names didn't satisfy the API published in the DRC user guide because there weren't the proper xacro parameters available.

I didn't realize it, but the drcsim xacro is already passing "l_hand" and "r_hand" as the xacro parameter named parent (referring to the parent link name). So without modifying drcsim, this pull request will fix the ROS topic API.

I also modified the sandia_hand_both_on_box model so that it would still work with this change.
summary.html:
In pull request #18, I mentioned that the ros topic names didn't satisfy the API published in the DRC user guide because there weren't the proper xacro parameters available.

I didn't realize it, but the drcsim xacro is already passing "l_hand" and "r_hand" as the xacro parameter named parent (referring to the parent link name). So without modifying drcsim, this pull request will fix the ROS topic API.

I also modified the sandia_hand_both_on_box model so that it would still work with this change.

values.description:
Debbuild will run compilation in bourne shell, which won't accept command like the one generated in sandia_hand_description/robots cmake, which is auto quoted just one part:

```"ROS_PAKCAGE_PATH=/..." rosrun ...```

This will try to fix that cmake auto quoting.
values.title: Fix problem when compiling into debbuild

summary.raw:
Debbuild will run compilation in bourne shell, which won't accept command like the one generated in sandia_hand_description/robots cmake, which is auto quoted just one part:

```"ROS_PAKCAGE_PATH=/..." rosrun ...```

This will try to fix that cmake auto quoting.
summary.html:
Debbuild will run compilation in bourne shell, which won't accept command like the one generated in sandia_hand_description/robots cmake, which is auto quoted just one part:

"ROS_PAKCAGE_PATH=/..." rosrun ...

This will try to fix that cmake auto quoting.

values.title: Add Gaussian noise to sandia hand cameras, issue #4

values.description:
For the drcsim tasks that do not involve manipulation, there is speculation that simplifying the dynamic model of the hands may improve performance. This pull request adds a parameter to be able to specify whether the fingers should have revolute joints or fixed joints. I also add a parameter called thumb_angle that can relocate the default position of the thumb so it is not in view of the camera when frozen.

This will break old versions of drcsim, so it will require a simulataneous release.
values.title: Generate quasi-static model: frozen fingers, but working cameras

summary.raw:
For the drcsim tasks that do not involve manipulation, there is speculation that simplifying the dynamic model of the hands may improve performance. This pull request adds a parameter to be able to specify whether the fingers should have revolute joints or fixed joints. I also add a parameter called thumb_angle that can relocate the default position of the thumb so it is not in view of the camera when frozen.

This will break old versions of drcsim, so it will require a simulataneous release.
summary.html:
For the drcsim tasks that do not involve manipulation, there is speculation that simplifying the dynamic model of the hands may improve performance. This pull request adds a parameter to be able to specify whether the fingers should have revolute joints or fixed joints. I also add a parameter called thumb_angle that can relocate the default position of the thumb so it is not in view of the camera when frozen.

This will break old versions of drcsim, so it will require a simulataneous release.

values.description:
Details:

 * made fingers softer by reducing `kp`.
 * disable velocity limits by making it negative.
 * set `min_depth` of 1mm and 3mm for more stable contact in sim.
 * reduce damping to 1 Nms/rad.
values.title: tuning sim contact parameters and changed simple shapes to FlatBlack

summary.raw:
Details:

 * made fingers softer by reducing `kp`.
 * disable velocity limits by making it negative.
 * set `min_depth` of 1mm and 3mm for more stable contact in sim.
 * reduce damping to 1 Nms/rad.
summary.html:
Details:

  • made fingers softer by reducing kp.
  • disable velocity limits by making it negative.
  • set min_depth of 1mm and 3mm for more stable contact in sim.
  • reduce damping to 1 Nms/rad.

~~~
/opt/ros/indigo/lib/sandia_hand_teleop/simple_grasp.py:163: SyntaxWarning: The publisher should be created with an explicit keyword argument 'queue_size'. Please see http://wiki.ros.org/rospy/Overview/Publishers%20and%20Subscribers for more information.
  g_jc_pub = rospy.Publisher('joint_commands', JointCommands) # same namespace
~~~

values.description:
Resolves [drcsim issue #465](#!/osrf/drcsim/issue/465).

Ran this command:

`find . -name "*.urdf.xacro" -exec sed -i -e 's/collision group=".*"/collision/g' {} \;`
values.title: Remove collision group names

summary.raw:
Resolves [drcsim issue #465](#!/osrf/drcsim/issue/465).

Ran this command:

`find . -name "*.urdf.xacro" -exec sed -i -e 's/collision group=".*"/collision/g' {} \;`
summary.html:

find . -name "*.urdf.xacro" -exec sed -i -e 's/collision group=".*"/collision/g' {} \;
